org.koreaderhistfavparser

Class KOReaderBook

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.koreaderhistfavparser.KOReaderBook

  • public class KOReaderBook
extends java.lang.Object
    The class for a book with properties read from KOReader sdr files.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      KOReaderBook(java.lang.String filePath)
      Constructs a new KOReaderBook with the specified file path.

        public KOReaderBook(java.lang.String filePath)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if given file path is invalid, e.g. without extension

    • Method Detail

      • getStringFormat

        public static java.lang.String getStringFormat()
        Returns the string format for the string representation with the format classifiers
        • %t: title,
        • %a: first author,
        • %p: progress in percent,
        • %s: series and
        • %l: language.
        Optional classifiers are set by square brackets. Defaults to [%a: ]%t[ (%p%)].
        Returns:
        the string format

      • setStringFormat

        public static void setStringFormat(java.lang.String stringFormat)
        Sets the string format for the string representation of all books with the format classifiers
        • %t: title,
        • %a: first author,
        • %p: progress in percent,
        • %s: series and
        • %l: language.
        Optional classifiers are set by square brackets. Defaults to [%a: ]%t[ (%p%)].
        Parameters:
        stringFormat - the string format

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns the hash code of the book's file path string.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        hash code

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the formatted string according to the specified string format with the format classifiers
        • %t: title,
        • %a: first author,
        • %p: progress in percent,
        • %s: series and
        • %l: language.
        Optional classifiers are set by square brackets. The string format can be set by setStringFormat(java.lang.String) and is returned by getStringFormat(). It defaults to [%a: ]%t[ (%p%)].
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        formatted string
